dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2152 IH: Safe Chicken and Meat for Children Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. DeLauro (for herself, Mr. Fortenberry, Mr. Rangel, Ms. Esty, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mrs. Kirkpatrick, Ms. Speier, Mr. Cárdenas, Ms. Slaughter, and Ms. Pingree) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To ban meat and poultry products processed in China from school lunches, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safe Chicken and Meat for Children Act.

section.header: Banning meat and poultry products processed in China from school lunches

subsection.text: Section 9(h) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1758(h)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibiting the use of certain meat and poultry
paragraph.text: A school participating in the school lunch program under this Act or the school breakfast program under section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1773) may not serve under such a program:

subparagraph.text: Poultry or poultry products (as defined in sections 4(e) and (f) of the Poultry Products Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 453(e) and (f))), produced or processed, in whole or in part, in the People's Republic of China.
Meat or meat food products (as defined in section 1(j) of the Federal Meat Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 601(j))), produced or processed, in whole or in part, in the People's Republic of China.

subsection.header: Child and adult care food program
subsection.text: Section 17(g)(2)(A) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(g)(2)(A)) is amended by striking this section shall consist of a combination of foods that meet minimum nutritional requirements prescribed by the Secretary on the basis of tested nutritional research. and inserting the following:

clause.text: shall consist of a combination of foods that meet minimum nutritional requirements prescribed by the Secretary on the basis of tested nutritional research; and
may not include the products described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of section 9(h)(6).

subsection.header: Summer food service program for children
subsection.text: Section 13(f)(1) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (7 U.S.C. 1431(f)(1)) is amended by striking this section shall serve meals consisting of a combination of foods and meeting minimum nutritional standards prescribed by the Secretary on the basis of tested nutritional research. and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: shall serve meals consisting of a combination of foods and meeting minimum nutritional standards prescribed by the Secretary on the basis of tested nutritional research; and
may not serve the products described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of section 9(h)(6).
